reasoning: Aggregate BOTEC estimate for alcohol-related liver diseases including: fatty liver disease (~15 per 100k), hepatitis (~5 per 100k), cirrhosis (~6 per 100k), and acute alcoholic hepatitis (~2 per 100k). Total ~28 per 100k annually. Low confidence due to heterogeneous conditions, significant geographic variation based on alcohol consumption patterns and healthcare access, and difficulty distinguishing alcohol-related from other liver disease etiologies.
source: WHO Global Status Report on Alcohol and Health, epidemiological estimates
